intro: Zingiber integrum, commonly known as the white ginger or white root ginger, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers like turmeric and cardamom. The plant features long, narrow leaves and produces clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical characteristics of Zingiber integrum make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and pharmacological study.
